entry.title: Taiwan Voters Snub Beijing Again, Leaving China With Few Good Options
entry.content: The increased prospect of friction cements the island’s status as a flashpoint between Washington and Beijing.

entry.title: Amid War in Middle East, Ukraine Fights to Keep U.S. and Allies' Focus
entry.content: Ukraine’s fight to eject Russian forces that control roughly 20% of its country has bogged down, without indications of imminent progress.

entry.title: After 100 Days, Israel's War With Hamas Threatens to Spill Beyond Gaza
entry.content: One of the biggest geopolitical events this century, the war has swung from a brutal Hamas attack to Israel’s ferocious retaliation—with no end in sight.

entry.title: U.S. Strikes Give Yemen's Houthis the Enemy They Long Sought
entry.content: A religiously inspired militia that emerged from Yemen’s northern mountains 20 years ago is now more powerful than ever.
